article: A while ago, I made a photo journey across the United States by bus. During this _ , I ended up in Seattle where I _ Laddie McCrea.Laddie, you see, was a hobo . He was about 60 years old but _ like 100. When I first met Laddie, he was standing on the side of a _ street greeting every person passing by with a smile,a pleasant greeting and an extended palm . Each day, people _ past Laddie--either not noticing that he was there or _ him -- a smelly hobo. I found Laddie to be a(n) _ character for my photo journey, so I paid him to allow me to stad in the background and _ him. I spent three days _ somewhere, and photographing Laddie. Most of the time he didn't know where I was. Each _ he stood in a busy place of town _ the world with a smile,just to earn some money for a meal. One _ day,as I watched from a bench off in the distance, a young girl, around six or seven,came to Laddie and _ him something. Laddie was _ about it. He reached in his pocket and gave the girl some thing. The girl ran back to her parents _ showing them what she had _ .I was so curious about the _ that I went to Laddie immediately and asked him what happened. Laddie _ :"The little girl came to me and gave me a coin, so I gave her two in return _ I wanted to show her that when you are generous, you will receive more than you give"
